article_text:
A Kentucky judge has ordered Grant Thornton to pay $100.2 million in damages to a hotel owner who says the accounting firm sold him an abusive tax shelter.

Grant Thornton was grossly negligent and misleading, and committed "varied and repeated misconduct" from the sale of the tax shelter in 2000 until at least 2007, and arguably all the way through a trial in the case last year, Judge Patricia Summe of Kenton County Circuit...
